post.description: Endpoint to register a new user and return JWT token.
Endpoint for user login and returning an access token.
Endpoint to invalidate the user’s JWT token.

401.description: Error during logout, e.g., token issues

post.description: Endpoint to request a password reset token by providing the user's email address.

200.description: Success response for forgot password request

400.description: Error response for forgot password request

post.description: Endpoint to verify OTP (token) sent to the user for password reset.
Endpoint to reset a user’s password after verifying the OTP.

400.description: Error response for password reset request

post.summary: Authenticate a user using Google token
post.description: This endpoint validates the provided Google token and email, creates or updates the user, and returns a JWT token upon successful authentication.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid token or mismatched email

422.description: Validation error for missing or invalid parameters

get.description: This endpoint redirects the user to Google for authentication. It is intended to be accessed via a browser. This endpoint initiates the OAuth 2.0 authentication process with Google.

302.description: Redirects the user to Google for authentication

get.description: This endpoint is called by Google after successful authentication. It handles user data from Google, creates or updates a user in the database, and returns a JWT token for authentication.

post.description: Alternative endpoint to handle Google authentication via POST when the redirect is not available. It updates or creates a user in the database and returns a JWT token for authentication.

401.description: Unauthorized error, invalid credentials or missing data

get.description: Redirects the user to Facebook for authentication. This endpoint cannot be tested directly via Postman or documentation tools as it performs a redirect.

get.summary: Handle Facebook callback and authenticate user
get.description: This endpoint handles the callback from Facebook after successful authentication, updates or creates the user, and returns a JWT token.

post.summary: Handle Facebook data submission and authenticate user
post.description: This endpoint processes Facebook user data sent via POST request, updates or creates the user, and returns a JWT token. It is used as an alternative to the GET callback for cases where direct data processing is needed.

400.description: Bad request error due to invalid data

get.summary: Revenue by months of the year

post.description: Allows authenticated users with appropriate permissions to initiate a payment through Flutterwave.
Allows authenticated users with appropriate permissions to initiate a payment through Paystack.

get.description: Fetch the details of a single billing plan.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the billing plan to retrieve

organization_id.description: ID of the organization making the payment

plan_id.description: ID of the plan being purchased

redirect_url.description: URL to redirect to after payment completion

message.example: Validation error: amount must be a positive number
You do not have permission to initiate this payment
An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later.
Account with the specified email doesn't exist
User does not exist or validation errors occurred

status.description: Indicates the user is being redirected to Google for authentication.

description.example: A comprehensive plan for premium users

ForgotPasswordErrorResponse.description: Error response for forgot password request

ResetPasswordErrorResponse.description: Error response for password reset request

GoogleRedirectResponse.description: Redirects the user to Google for authentication

GoogleUnauthorizedError.description: Unauthorized error, invalid credentials or missing data

BadRequestResponse.description: Bad request error due to invalid data

GoogleRequest400.description: Bad request due to invalid token or mismatched email

password.description: Required password with minimum 8 characters including letters, mixed case, numbers, and symbols

Email address associated with the OTP
Email address of the user requesting the password reset

password.description: New password for the user, must meet security requirements

avatar_original.description: URL of the Google user's avatar

token.description: The Google access token received from the client.

email.description: The email associated with the Google token.
